thread.title: H.S. girls volleyball: Waldwick's Penny Gastman earns her 200th career win - Sports
thread.title_full: H.S. girls volleyball: Waldwick's Penny Gastman earns her 200th career win - Sports - NorthJersey.com

author: FROM STAFF REPORTS |
title: H.S. girls volleyball: Waldwick's Penny Gastman earns her 200th career win - Sports
text:
The Waldwick volleyball team gave coach Penny Gastman confetti, cupcakes and a keepsake after she picked up her 200th career win on Friday.
Gastman proudly held up a poster signed by the players after the Warriors (5-5) got her to the milestone with a 25-6, 25-22 home victory over Hawthorne Christian.
“I’ve enjoyed my time at Waldwick. I’m very proud,” Gastman said. “I cherish all the years that I’ve been here. And I think about the accomplishments of our athletes.”
Gastman, of River Edge, played volleyball for Bogota High School and Ramapo College before coming to Waldwick. She’s built the Warriors into a perennial power, despite being at one of the smallest schools in North Jersey. During her 15-year tenure, the Warriors are 200-103 and have won three division titles, most recently in 2011.
“The most important thing is always about teaching,” Gastman said. “I’ve had a consistent coaching staff for the past 10 years, so I think we work really well together. Generally speaking, we’ve taught the girls to be well-rounded in all the spots and not just their positions.”
